Html:
Can we use this to capture the form close or exit events?

We have been trying to find a way to capture this event on a PowerShell form to do some cleanup when the user clicks the X, but we can't seem to figure it out.

It has been a while since I wrote any .NET code so, my knowledge on event handlers is a little rusty.

Thank You,

Kevin

Hi Kevin,

Yes, you could use this for that. Before we proceed though, are you using powershell 1.0 or 2.0? Because 2.0 has built in support for event handling.

-Oisin

Yes we are using Powershell 2.0.  We have not been able to find any good documentation on event handling with Powershell 1 or 2.

If you have any information or docs to send us to, or even an example :)  that would be appreciated.

Thank You,

Kevin

Here's an example in v1 style: http://www.techotopia.com/index.php/Creating_GUIs_in_Windows_PowerShell_1.0_with_WinForms

here's some with v2: http://powershell.labs.oreilly.com/ch31.html and http://powershell.labs.oreilly.com/ch13.html#program_add_a_graphical_user_interface_t

-Oisin
